bubble.question: Q1. What is the average case time complexity for a bubble sort?
Q2. What is the best case time complexity for a bubble sort?
Q3. What is the worst case time complexity for a bubble sort?
Q4. What is the space complexity for a bubble sort?
Q5. How many passes are needed to sort a list of 8 elements?
Q6. What would the third pass of the following array be: 20,16,12,8,4,1?
Q7. How many swaps are needed to sort the following list: 8,22,7,9,31,5,13?
Q8. What is one way to optimise a bubble sort?
bubble.right: End when no swaps have been made in a pass
bubble.wrong2: You cannot optimise a bubble sort
bubble.wrong3: Skip every other element if the list is partially sorted

bubble.question: Q9. What is the number of swaps needed to sort the following list: 8,22,7,9,31,5,13?
Q10. How many passes will occur in an optimised bubble sort with the following list: 1,2,4,3

quick.question: Q1. What is the average case time complexity for a quick sort?
Q2. What is the best case time complexity for a quick sort?
Q3. What is the worst case time complexity for a quick sort?
Q4. What is the space complexity for a quick sort?
Q5. Which element is the most effective choice as a pivot?
Q6. How many sub-arrays are used with a quick sort?
quick.wrong2: N, each element has its own array
quick.wrong3: None, only the main array is used

quick.question: Q7. What is the sequence after the first phase: 7,11,14,6,9,3,12; pivot=7
Q8. In which case is the best case reached with a quick sort?
quick.right: When the pivot is always the median

quick.question: Q9. When does the worst case occur with a quick sort?
quick.wrong2: When the pivot is the average of all the values

quick.question: Q10. Which sort is the quick sort an optimised version of?

merge.question: Q1. What is the average case time complexity for a merge sort?
Q2. What is the best case time complexity for a merge sort?
Q3. What is the worst case time complexity for a merge sort?
Q4. What is the space complexity for a merge sort?
Q5. How many sublists are used in a merge sort?
merge.right: N, however many elements there are
merge.wrong1: 2, the list is split in half
merge.wrong2: 3, the list is split into thirds
merge.wrong3: None, only the main list is used

merge.question: Q6. What would the third pass of the following array be: 20,16,12,8,4,1?
Q7. Which algorithm is less dependent on initial ordering than merge sort?
merge.right: None, merge sort depents the least on the initial list order

merge.question: Q8. What is one way to optimise a bubble sort?
merge.right: End when no swaps have been made in a pass
merge.wrong2: You cannot optimise a bubble sort
merge.wrong3: Skip every other element if the list is partially sorted

merge.question: Q9. Which technique does merge sort use?
Q10. How many passes will occur in an optimised bubble sort with the following list: 1,2,4,3
